text: this is the conversation between customer and agent. customer asked There are advertisements everywhere here in hong kong. The city is so bright at night, with all the neon signs. agent replied I like it. It makes the city feel alive. I like all the different colors and I like the billboards with eye-catching pictures and slogans. customer asked I think that there are too many of them. I think that companies spend far too much money on advertising. They should have lower prices instead. Then they would see more. agent replied I see your point, but if companies didn't spend money on advertising, no one would hear about their products. I agree that some form of advertising can be annoying. I don't like it when people try to give you leaflets with information about products you have no intention of buying. customer asked I really hate receiving spam. I also dislike having to listen to advertisements and jingles when they are broadcast in stores or on the subway. agent replied Yes, that annoys me too. With billboards, you can look away, but with broadcasts, you can't avoid them. I like the way that advertising agencies use comedy in their campaign. customer asked I like that too. I don't like the way that advertising campaign often tell you if you don't buy a certain product, you're not cool or modern or efficient or something. agent replied That kind of advertising seems to be very common with brand name products. They are always trying to maintain brand loyalty.
summary: and talk about advertisements in Hong Kong. likes the billboards, while thinks there're too many advertisements. They both hate leaflets and broadcasts but like the way that advertising agencies use comedy in their campaign.

Two good examples are Seattle, in the state of Washington, and Portland, Oregon. customer asked Tell us about some cold cities. agent replied In the north there are many cities which are very cold in the winter. Boston and Chicago are two of them. customer asked Is it always cold in Chicago and Boston? agent replied Oh, no. On the contrary, there are many beautiful days, especially in the spring and fall.

text: this is the conversation between customer and agent. customer asked Good afternoon, Dr. Anderson's office. agent replied Hello, my name is John Keat, and I was hoping I could come in today to see the doctor. customer asked Are you a patient of Dr. Anderson? agent replied Well, no. I'm at a convention from Mexico and the manager of the hotel where I'm staying suggested that I call you. customer asked Well, I see. What seems to be the problem? agent replied Well, I got this ringing in my ears. It's so terrible that I can hardly hear people talking now. customer asked Are you in any pain or is there any fluid? agent replied No discharge, just a slight earache. customer asked Does the pain happen all the time, or once in a while. agent replied It has been aching for two days and it's never stopped. I thought it might be due to my flying in the air, and after some rest it'll be all gone. But who knows it's getting worse. I need to see the doctor. customer asked The doctor will be busy at the hospital until this evening. The earliest you could see him would be tomorrow morning at ten. agent replied The time is good for me. I'll come in then if that's okay. customer asked That will be fine; in the meantime you should try to take it easy. Don't press your ear and don't have water in when you take a shower. agent replied Do I have to bring something when I'm seeing the doctor, since I have never seen a doctor in Canada. customer asked For foreign visitors, I guess you may bring your passport for the hospital registration. agent replied Yes, I will. Thank you for your help. customer asked Thanks for calling. See you.
summary: John Keat comes to Dr. Anderson's office and describes his earache to John Keat wants to see the doctor, but says the doctor will be busy until this evening. tells John to come tomorrow at ten with his passport.

[Okay, Okay] when this woman knocked me right off my feet, grabbed my stuff, and ran off through the trees. [Hmm]. I was so surprised by the ordeal that I didn't go after her. agent replied Yeah. Can you describe the woman for me? customer asked Yeah. He was about a hundred and ninety centimeters tall ... agent replied Wait. You said a woman robbed you. customer asked Well, I'm not really sure. [Hmm]. You see, the person was wearing a white and black polka dot dress, a light red sweater over it, and she ... or he ... was wearing a pair of basketball shoes. agent replied Humm. What else can you tell me? customer asked Okay. Like I said, the person was about centimeters tall, heavy build, with long wavy hair. She ... or he ... was probably in his or her late I didn't get a good look at the person's face, but well ... uh .... agent replied What? Was there something else? customer asked Well, the person ... had a beard. agent replied Ah! What was, uh, taken ... exactly? customer asked Well, just my left shoe. Bizarre, isn't it? agent replied Ah. The 'bearded woman' has struck again! customer asked The 'bearded woman'? agent replied Yeah. It's this man who dresses up like a woman and, for some unknown reason, removes the left shoe from his victims. He's really quite harmless, though, and he usually returns the shoe to the crime scene a couple of days later. customer asked Hey, he can keep my shoe, and I'll just take off my left shoe every time I walk through the park.
summary: reports a theft to a policeman. describes the appearance of the thief and the policeman recognizes the bearded woman who often removes the victim's left shoe and returns after days.

text: this is the conversation between customer and agent. customer asked Now we have settled the terms of payment. In fact, many of our clients are placing orders for delivery in the fourth quarter. customer asked Mr. Brown, you certainly realize that the time of delivery is a matter of great importance to us. If we place our goods on the market at a time when all other importers have already sold their goods at profitable prices, we shall lose out. agent replied I see your point. However, we have done more business this year than any of the previous years. I am very sorry to say that we cannot advance the time of delivery. customer asked That's too bad, but I sincerely hope you will give our request your special consideration. agent replied You may take it from me that the last thing we want to do is to disappoint an old customer like you. But the fact remains that our manufacturers have a heavy backlog on their hands. customer asked But can't you find some way to get round your producers for an earlier delivery? Make a special effort, please. A timely delivery means a lot to us. agent replied All right. We'll get in touch with our producers and see what they have to say.
summary: thinks the earliest shipment can provide is too late and requests to advance the time of delivery. refuses due to several specific reasons, but finally is persuaded to contact the producers to see if they can help.

text: this is the conversation between customer and agent. customer asked Good afternoon, how can I help you? agent replied Someone has stolen my gold necklace. customer asked I am sorry to hear about that. It has to be one of your maids who took it. I want my necklace back. customer asked Well, I understand how you feel, and we will try to do our best to help you. But first please allow me to send one of the housemaids to your room to look for it again thoroughly, just in case it's still in there. If she finds it, we will all be happy. If she doesn't, we will turn the whole matter to the police. But I must say that the hotel can't be held responsible for your loss. You should have locked your gold necklace away at the hotel's safety box. If you had read your key card carefully, you would have realized that we specially warned you to do so. agent replied That just isn't good enough. Cet me your general manager. I want to speak to him now. customer asked I am sorry, ma'am. Our general manager is not in town. But I'd be more than glad to get you our assistant manager, if you like. But I am afraid that he will say the same thing. We have very clear instructions about valuables and we must follow them. And now if you will excuse me, I'll go and find our assistant manager for you.
summary: claims that her necklace has been stolen. asks about some details. suggests sending one housemaid to look for it again thoroughly. text: this is the conversation between customer and agent. customer asked I like chess better than xiangqi. And you? agent replied For my part, xiangqi. Look at the king in chess, he is much more capable. agent replied Yeah, and though the king in chess doesn't have bodyguards, he has a queen who is the most powerful piece. I think this demonstrates the relatively higher social status of aristocratic women in medieval Europe than in China. customer asked There's another distinctive contrast. Both board games use a total of pieces, but xiangqi is played on a - by - board, bigger than the - by - board used in chess. agent replied You mean, xiangqi pieces are allowed a larger space in which to move around? customer asked Sure. On a chessboard, fire is much more intensive. It has a smaller board, while those bigger pieces-chariots, horses and bishops-can cover longer distances.
summary: and discuss the differences between chess and xiangqi. Both of them think chess is more reasonable than xiangqi in certain rules, but think xiangqi has a larger space in which to move around.

text: this is the conversation between customer and agent. customer asked Dear audiences, today we'll talk about divorce and its effect on children. Our guest is Jennifer Benzes. Thank you for coming, Jennifer. Do you mind saying something about your divorce? agent replied No. I got divorced years ago. Even worse, I got divorced when I had small children. customer asked Have you thought of the effect divorce may have on your children? Their needs can be forgotten as parents are struggling to re-establish their lives. agent replied Of course, we have. We are definitely more aware of the impact on children. After all we are not famous people who trade spouses like shoes. For most of us divorce is not entered into lightly. We all suffer. Anyway, we try to comfort our children. customer asked How? agent replied We tell them we love them and will always do. customer asked You haven't thought of saving the marriage? agent replied Yes, we have. We would do anything to spare our children pain. But you know, fixing a marriage is not like changing a tire. Family conflicts may take hold like a cancer. customer asked Then divorce is the only way to get rid of it. agent replied It's true with me. Others may succeed in fixing. customer asked Yet most people believe a hard marriage is better for children than a divorce. According to a recent poll, more people today think parents should stay together for the sake of the children What do you think? agent replied I think the cost of staying together is worse than the benefits. Parents quarreling and fighting all day may do more harm to their children. customer asked What do you want society to do for you? agent replied Understand us, not curse us. More importantly, they should help us share the loss and build a better future.
summary: Jennifer Benzes is sharing her divorce and its impact on her children with the audience. She thinks fixing a marriage isn't better for children though most people think the opposite and she wants society to understand them instead of cursing them.

text: this is the conversation between customer and agent. customer asked Trina, will you marry me? agent replied Yes! Yes! And yes! Your sister's husband could get us a discount with that company that does the decor at weddings. what's their name again? summary: Trina accepts Jared's proposal. Then, Jared is astonished to know that Trina already knew from Melissa who saw him buying the ring that he was planning this. text: this is the conversation between customer and agent. customer asked Excuse me. I need to refill this prescription. agent replied It says on the bottle here that you can have two refills. customer asked Yes, I need to refill it today. agent replied Alright. I'm sorry, Miss. According to our file, this prescription has already been refilled twice. customer asked I was worried about that. I couldn't remember if I had it refilled twice yet or not. agent replied Well, it looks like you have.You will need to see your doctor to get a new prescription. customer asked Listen. This is an emergency. I tried to call my doctor, but he is out of town. So I can't see him in time. I need this medicine. It is for skin condition. I've run out.Can you just refill it once more? agent replied I'm sorry, Miss. We can't do it. We must follow the prescription.And this prescription has run out. customer asked But I need it. Please. Refill it for me just this once. I can go to the doctor around ten days from now. Then I'll have another prescription. agent replied Miss, I understand your problem.But it is against the law for us to sell certain medicines without a prescription.It ' s the law. I can't do anything about it.We never sell medicine unless we have a proper prescription. Never. customer asked But I have a prescription. I just need more of it. agent replied A prescription must be valid. It cannot be an expired prescription. I'm sorry, Miss. It's the law.You will have to find another doctor who will prescribe this for you. customer asked Oh, it will be so expensive! I have a special medical plan, and I can only see one doctor.It will cost me a lot of money to see another doctor. agent replied Miss, I just can't help you on this. I'm a pharmacist, not a doctor. And there are other customers I need to help now. I know it is frustrating when this happens.But there is nothing I can do about it. I'm sorry. customer asked This is ridiculous! In Taiwan, it is much easier to get medicine when I need it. agent replied Maybe that's true. I don't know.But I'm sure in Taiwan you have prescriptions too.
summary: asks to refill a prescription but refuses her because it has been refilled twice. insists as it's an emergency. says it's illegal to sell medicine without a valid prescription and suggests see another doctor. says it's expensive to see a new doctor and thinks it is ridiculous as it's much easier to get medicine in Taiwan.

text: this is the conversation between customer and agent. customer asked I think that show biz stars have a really easy life. They have lots of money, so they can buy almost anything they want. summary: and hold different views on show biz stars. thinks they have an easy life, they love publicity to get them more films and social activities, they are overpaid, over-ambitious, and over-adored. But shows sympathy to show biz stars and thinks should give them some credit.

text: this is the conversation between customer and agent. customer asked Are the galaxies in the universe moving through space? agent replied No, the galaxies sit more or less passively in the space around them. If galaxies are moving apart from each other, how can they collide? agent replied Well, the universe is a chaotic place, and the gravity from one galaxy, or from a group of galaxies, may disturb the motion of its near neighbors, causing them to collide. However, on average, when you compare two large enough chunks of space, the galaxies in one are moving away from the galaxies in the other. customer asked Wow, you're really informative. summary: answers questions of whether the galaxies in the universe are moving through space and how the galaxies collide. thinks is informative.

text: this is the conversation between customer and agent. customer asked Welcome. Last month big leap in new job, some plus, is a huge increase over what the country has seen in the past months when the average growth has been just new jobs a month. For a closer look at what's happening, we turn to Lisa Lynch, an economics professor at Tofts University. Lisa Lynch, when you look at these numbers, do you think job creation is on the rise? agent replied It certainly is. It was a great report. It indicates that the job market, broadly speaking, has turned the corner after very long, lean years. I think we are going to see improvement. It's not only the March gain. It was gain in January and February. They were both revised higher, and moreover, the job gains were very broadly-based across many industries. It was a very positive report. customer asked What do you see in the numbers? Who's getting the new jobs? agent replied As I mentioned, when we looked at the numbers, 'we are seeing employment across the board in all sectors, with one important exception, and that's in manufacturing. Well, we do not have any job loss in manufacturing sector for the first time in months. We did not see pick up in the manufacturing sector, but we saw restaurant and hotel workers being added on. We saw workers in supermarket being added on. Part of that reflects the settlement of the grocery stores strike out California. We saw workers in the health care sector and hospitals being added on. We saw business services adding employees. So in general, with the very important exception of manufacturing, we are seeing job growth across all of these different types of occupations.
summary: interviews Lisa Lynch about her opinion on the big leap in new jobs created last month. Lisa says the report is positive because it shows the job market's improvement after three lean years. All industries including catering, health care, and services experience positive growth, except for manufacturing which has neither job loss nor picking up.

text: this is the conversation between customer and agent. customer asked Tom, I married Julia last month. Have you already known it? agent replied No, I haven't. I'm so surprised at the news. customer asked Indeed, we got married too soon. agent replied Congratulations. But have you heard the proverb that if one gets married too hurriedly one may regret it for a long time? customer asked Yes. However, I believe that marriage comes by destiny. I knew I would marry Julia when I met her at the first time. agent replied How's your married life? customer asked We're happy together now. agent replied I have to say you're a well-matched couple. customer asked Thank you!
summary: tells Tom he and Julia got married hurriedly but they are happy.

text: this is the conversation between customer and agent. customer asked Have you ever seen Bill Gate's home on the internet? agent replied No. what's it like? customer asked It's got its own library, theatre, swimming pool, and a guest house. The house itself has about ten different rooms that are all hooked up to computers so you can get things done in each room through a remote control. It's also located near the sea, so he can park his boats next to his house. It's absolutely amazing! agent replied Would you want to live there? customer asked I think his house is fantastic, but I wouldn't want to live there. You would have to hire one or two people to clean all the rooms in the house, plus a few people to take care of the gardens, and probably an au pair or two to take care of the children. It's just too big of a place to take care of on your own. agent replied What's your dreamhome like then? customer asked My dream home is actually just a small cottage in a quiet village in England. agent replied Would you want to buy an old cottage or build a new one yourself? customer asked Old homes are great because they've got character. I think that's important. agent replied Is that why you wear second-hand clothes as well? Because they've got character? customer asked No, that's just because I don't have enough money to buy new cloths all the time! agent replied I see. If you lived in an old house, would it be decorated in a modern way? customer asked No, I'd definitely try to restore it to its original state. I love to imagine what it'd be like to live in another time in history and living in a house decorated like it would have been years ago would be a great way to feed my imagination even more!
summary: tells what Bill Gate's home like. It's got its own library, theatre, swimming pool, and a guest house. doesn't want to live there because it's too big to take care of by one person. prefers old cottages in a quiet village in England because they've got characters.

text: this is the conversation between customer and agent. customer asked What can I do for you, sir? agent replied What have you got this morning? customer asked Fruit juice, cakes and refreshments, and everything. agent replied I'd like to have a glass of tomato juice, please. customer asked Any cereal, sir? agent replied Yes, a dish of cream of wheat. customer asked And eggs? agent replied Yes, bacon and eggs with buttered toast. I like my bacon very crisp. customer asked How do you want your eggs? agent replied Fried, please. customer asked Anything more, sir? agent replied No, that's enough. T hank you.
summary: orders tomato juice, a dish of cream of wheat, crisp bacon, and fried eggs.

text: this is the conversation between customer and agent. customer asked Excuse me, is there a table for right now? agent replied Let me see. . . I am sorry the tables you want are booked. customer asked Well, since there are some small square tables, could we put two tables together? agent replied No problem, sir. Let me help you.
summary: helps put two tables together to make it for people.

text: this is the conversation between customer and agent. customer asked I am totally fed up with my boss. He has crossed the line one too many times with his sexist comments. This time I am really going to report him for sexual harassment. agent replied What happened? Did your boss say something to offend you at work? customer asked He constantly lets inappropriate things slip out, referring to the women employees as girls or calling us sweetheart or darling. I doubt any of my male colleagues would stand for such treatment. agent replied Don't you think you are overreacting a little? Calling you by nicknames shouldn't be so bad... customer asked You're missing the point. It's about respect. He treats us with such a patronizing attitude, as if we are not equal or not as serious as our male co-workers. It's his attitude that needs to be changed, not just his words. agent replied That's what you get for working in a male-dominated field. I think you'll find that most male bosses in your industry are already conditioned to treat females in this way. You probably won't be able to change him.
summary: complains to about her boss's sexist comments. is going to report him for sexual harassment. thinks is overreacting and she can't change her boss.

text: this is the conversation between customer and agent. customer asked Now that it's the new year, I've decided to turn over a new leaf. agent replied Yeah? You finally decided to wipe the slate clean? customer asked You got it! I have a new job, I'm living in a new city, with new friends! This is my opportunity to make some small changes in the way I live my life. agent replied So what are you going to do? Take up an art class or something? customer asked Well, first of all, I've decided to stop smoking. It's not that I'm pinching pennies or anything, it's just that I've been smoking since I was sixteen, and I think it's time to stop. agent replied I'm with you on that one. Anything else you're planning on doing? customer asked One last thing, I've decided to come out of the closet. agent replied It's about time!
summary: decides to stop smoking and come out of the closet in the new year. supports

text: this is the conversation between customer and agent. customer asked You married Joe, didn't you? agent replied Joe? I don't know what you mean. customer asked I remember you are in love. agent replied Oh, I took a shine to him when we met for the first time. But it comes and goes. customer asked It's Greek to me.
summary: thought married Joe. denies.

text: this is the conversation between customer and agent. customer asked How can I help you mam? agent replied I was hoping you could look at my car today for the past few weeks. It has been making very strange noises. customer asked What kinds of noises? agent replied It sounds as if something is being damaged in the wheels. It only happens when I'm slowing down. customer asked Wow, it sounds like you need new brakes.You'll have to leave the car with us until tomorrow. agent replied Gosh, I was thinking you'd be able to get it back to me this afternoon. customer asked Unfortunately, we need to order the parts and we can't get started until they arrive. If I order them now, they'll be here this afternoon or tomorrow morning at the latest. agent replied I see. Well, why don't I just bring my car back in the morning? There is a show I really want to see downtown tonight. customer asked I don't think that's a good idea. You're risking your life by driving this car. If I were you I'd check the bus schedule.
summary: car makes noises. thinks it needs new brakes but can't get it fixed until tomorrow. wants to drive to a show tonight; suggests take a bus.

text: this is the conversation between customer and agent. customer asked Hello, Amazon's customer service. How can I help you? agent replied Hello, it's the book I got from your website yesterday when I was reading it. I found that one page is missing, page customer asked I see. May I have your order number, sir? agent replied It's Dash customer asked OK. Let me check. It's the paper bag night of the Hunter written by RA Salvatore you bought on our web days ago, which is on October thirteenth, right? agent replied Yes. customer asked Well, we might need you to take a photo of the missing part of this book and upload it to the customer service page of our website. And when the problem is confirmed, we will send you a new book in days. agent replied OK. Then what should I do with the old book? Should I send it back to you or something? customer asked That won't be necessary, sir. You can keep it if you like. Is there anything more I can help you with? agent replied No, thanks. customer asked You are welcome, sir. Have a nice day.
summary: calls Amazon's customer service because one page is missing in the book he got from Amazon. says they will send him a new book after the problem is confirmed.

text: this is the conversation between customer and agent. customer asked I can't believe it's almost summer. agent replied Yeah, I know. The year went really fast. customer asked What are you going to do this summer vacation? agent replied I'm going to work for a company. customer asked A company? What's that? What do you do? agent replied We help at parties. Our company prepares and serves the food, and usually another company provides the music. customer asked I didn't know you could cook. agent replied I don't have to cook. I'm only an assistant. customer asked When do you start? agent replied Tomorrow. We're helping a birthday party. Then a big family get together. customer asked So, what exactly do you do? agent replied Before the party starts, I help set everything up. You know, bring the food in and arrange the tables, make sure it looks nice. customer asked Sounds pretty easy. agent replied That's only the first part. During the party, I have to serve food and drinks to the guests. customer asked Well, at least you get to meet people. agent replied Yeah, and after the party is finished, I help clean up. customer asked Yuck, I hate to wash dishes. agent replied Oh, I don't wash dishes. Someone else does. I just put everything in the truck. customer asked That's not so bad. Sounds like a cool job.
summary: tells is going to work for a company helping at parties during the summer vacation. thinks that's a cool job.
